definition: Defense aircrafts such as fighter jets, helicopters, and UAVs.

system_types_specific.name: Fighter
system_types_specific.definition: Combat aircraft designed for air-to-air combat. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** F-35 Lightning II, F-16, F-22, F-15EX, F/A-18.

system_types_specific.name: Transport Aircraft
system_types_specific.definition: Aircraft designed for transporting troops, weapons, and other military equipment. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** C-130 Hercules, C-17 Globemaster III, A400M Atlas, C-27J Spartan, C-295.

system_types_specific.name: Trainers
system_types_specific.definition: Aircraft designed for flight training of pilots and aircrew. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** T-7A Red Hawk, T-6 Texan II, Pilatus PC-21, Hawk, M-346 Master.

system_types_specific.name: Tanker
system_types_specific.definition: Aircraft designed for aerial refueling of other aircraft. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** KC-46 Pegasus, KC-135 Stratotanker, A330 MRTT, KC-130J.

system_types_specific.name: Maritime Aircraft
system_types_specific.definition: Aircraft designed for maritime patrol, anti-submarine warfare, and anti-surface warfare. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** P-8 Poseidon, P-3 Orion, ATR 72 MP, C-295 MPA.

system_types_specific.name: C4ISR
system_types_specific.definition: Aircraft designed for Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** E-3 Sentry (AWACS), E-2 Hawkeye, RC-135 Rivet Joint, Global 6000 (modified).

system_types_specific.name: Fixed Wing Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other fixed-wing aircraft not covered by the main categories. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Gliders, Experimental aircraft, Special mission aircraft not fitting other categories.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_specific.name: Attack Helicopter
system_types_specific.definition: Helicopters designed for attacking ground targets. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** AH-64 Apache, AH-1Z Viper, Eurocopter Tiger, Mi-24 Hind, Ka-52 Alligator.

system_types_specific.name: Transport Helicopter
system_types_specific.definition: Helicopters designed for transporting troops and cargo. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** CH-47 Chinook, CH-53K King Stallion, UH-60 Black Hawk, Mi-17, NH90.

system_types_specific.name: Utility Helicopter
system_types_specific.definition: Helicopters designed for general-purpose utility roles. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** UH-1Y Venom, H145M, AW139, Bell 412.

system_types_specific.name: Maritime Helicopter
system_types_specific.definition: Helicopters designed for naval operations. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** MH-60R Seahawk, NH90 NFH, AW159 Wildcat, Merlin HM2.

system_types_specific.name: Scout Helicopter
system_types_specific.definition: Helicopters designed for reconnaissance and observation. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** OH-58 Kiowa, Bell 407, MD 530.

system_types_specific.name: Rotary Wing Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other rotary-wing aircraft. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Tiltrotors (V-22 Osprey - often categorized here or separate), Autogyros.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_specific.name: MALE UAV
system_types_specific.definition: Medium-Altitude Long-Endurance UAV. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** MQ-9 Reaper, MQ-1 Predator, Bayraktar TB2, Heron TP.

system_types_specific.name: HALE UAV
system_types_specific.definition: High-Altitude Long-Endurance UAV. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** RQ-4 Global Hawk, MQ-4C Triton.

system_types_specific.name: Tactical UAV
system_types_specific.definition: UAVs designed for tactical surveillance and reconnaissance. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** RQ-7 Shadow, ScanEagle, Blackjack.

system_types_specific.name: Mini/Micro UAV
system_types_specific.definition: Small UAVs used for close-range surveillance. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Raven, Puma, Black Hornet.

system_types_specific.name: UCAV
system_types_specific.definition: Unmanned Combat Aerial Vehicle. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** X-47B, nEUROn, Taranis, Okhotnik.

system_types_specific.name: Loitering Munition
system_types_specific.definition: Munitions that loiter over a target area before attacking. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Switchblade, Harop, Hero series.

system_types_specific.name: UAV Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other types of UAVs. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Target drones, cargo UAVs.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_general.name: Other Lift Types
system_types_general.definition: Other types of aerial lift platforms.

system_types_specific.name: Lighter-than-Air
system_types_specific.definition: Aircraft that float in the air (e.g., blimps, aerostats). **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** JLENS, Tethered Aerostat Radar System.

system_types_specific.name: Spaceplane
system_types_specific.definition: Vehicles that operate in space but land like aircraft. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** X-37B.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_specific.name: Main Battle Tank
system_types_specific.definition: Heavily armored and armed combat vehicles. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M1 Abrams, Leopard 2, Challenger 2, T-90, Merkava.

system_types_specific.name: Infantry Fighting Vehicle
system_types_specific.definition: Armored vehicles designed to transport infantry into battle and provide fire support. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M2 Bradley, Puma, CV90, BMP-3.

system_types_specific.name: Armoured Personnel Carrier
system_types_specific.definition: Armored vehicles designed to transport personnel. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M113, Stryker (ICV variant), Boxer, Patria AMV.

system_types_specific.name: Armoured Reconnaissance Vehicle
system_types_specific.definition: Armored vehicles designed for reconnaissance. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Ajax, Fennek, CRV.

system_types_specific.name: Mine Protected Vehicle
system_types_specific.definition: Vehicles designed to withstand landmine and IED attacks (MRAP). **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Cougar, MaxxPro, Bushmaster.

system_types_specific.name: AFV Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other armored fighting vehicles. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Tank destroyers, combat engineering vehicles (if armored).

system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_specific.definition: Artillery equipped with its own propulsion system. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M109 Paladin, PzH 2000, K9 Thunder, Archer.

system_types_specific.name: Towed Artillery
system_types_specific.definition: Artillery that is towed by another vehicle. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M777, L118 Light Gun.

system_types_specific.name: Multiple Rocket Launcher
system_types_specific.definition: Rocket artillery systems. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M142 HIMARS, M270 MLRS, BM-21 Grad.

system_types_specific.name: Mortar
system_types_specific.definition: Muzzle-loading indirect fire weapon. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M120, M224.

system_types_specific.name: Artillery Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other types of artillery. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Coastal artillery, anti-aircraft guns (if categorized here).

system_types_specific.name: Light Utility Vehicle
system_types_specific.definition: Lightweight vehicles for general utility. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** HMMWV (Humvee), JLTV, G-Wagon.

system_types_specific.name: Truck
system_types_specific.definition: Military trucks for transport and logistics. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** FMTV, HEMTT, MAN HX series.

system_types_specific.name: Tactical Vehicle Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other tactical vehicles. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** All-terrain vehicles (ATVs), motorcycles.

system_types_general.definition: Vehicles and equipment for logistics and support.

system_types_specific.name: Engineering Vehicle
system_types_specific.definition: Vehicles designed for construction and demolition tasks. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M9 ACE, ABV, Bridge layers.

system_types_specific.name: Recovery Vehicle
system_types_specific.definition: Vehicles designed to recover other vehicles. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M88 Hercules, Buffalo.

system_types_specific.name: Logistics Support Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other logistics and support vehicles. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Ambulances, command posts, fuel tankers.

system_types_general.name: Unmanned Ground Vehicles
system_types_general.definition: Vehicles that operate on the ground without an onboard human presence.

system_types_specific.name: Combat UGV
system_types_specific.definition: UGVs designed for combat. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Ripsaw, Uran-9.

system_types_specific.name: ISR UGV
system_types_specific.definition: UGVs designed for intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** PackBot, Talon.

system_types_specific.name: Logistics UGV
system_types_specific.definition: UGVs designed for logistics and transport. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** SMET, MUTT.

system_types_specific.name: EOD UGV

definition: Defense vessels such as submarines, aircraft carriers, and destroyers.

system_types_specific.name: Ballistic Missile Submarine
system_types_specific.definition: Submarines designed to launch ballistic missiles (SSBN). **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Ohio class, Columbia class, Vanguard class, Borei class.

system_types_specific.name: Attack Submarine
system_types_specific.definition: Submarines designed to attack other submarines and ships (SSN/SSK). **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Virginia class, Astute class, Los Angeles class, Type 212.

system_types_specific.name: Cruise Missile Submarine
system_types_specific.definition: Submarines designed to launch cruise missiles (SSGN). **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Oscar class, Ohio class (converted).

system_types_specific.name: Midget Submarine
system_types_specific.definition: Small submarines used for special operations. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** SDV.

system_types_specific.name: Sub-Surface Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other sub-surface vessels. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Research submarines, rescue submarines.

system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_general.name: Surface Combatants
system_types_general.definition: Ships designed for warfare on the surface of the water.

system_types_specific.name: Destroyer

system_types_specific.name: Frigate
system_types_specific.definition: Warships smaller than destroyers. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** FREMM, Type 26, FFG(X).

system_types_specific.name: Corvette

system_types_specific.definition: Other surface combatants. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Littoral Combat Ships (LCS).

system_types_general.definition: Ships designed to support amphibious operations.

system_types_specific.name: Landing Platform Dock
system_types_specific.definition: Amphibious warfare ships with a well deck. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** San Antonio class.

system_types_specific.name: Amphibious Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other amphibious ships. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Landing craft.

system_types_specific.definition: Ships designed to transport troops and equipment.

system_types_specific.name: Auxiliary Other
